title: Typeface used for Twinings Tea PLEASE
author: drarwin

comments.content:
what font is used for the London part

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023142904im_/http:/typophile.com/files/blackcurrant_4048.jpg)
Looks like a variation of Font Bureau's [Sloop Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023142904/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/script/Sloop/styles)
yes it does thanks a million

Did you want any of the other type ID'd? BLACKCURRANT, for example, is [Gill Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023142904/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/gill-sans/), perhaps predictably. TWININGS is very close to [Times New Roman Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023142904/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/times-new-roman/).

- Mike Yanega
